itineraries.title: Authentic Sri Lanka: Cultural Triangle and Paradise Beaches

visits.text: Arrival at Bandaranaike International Airport and transfer to Anuradhapura, one of Sri Lanka's ancient capitals. This inaugural journey immediately immerses you in the island's mystical atmosphere, crossing lush landscapes of coconut palms and verdant rice paddies. Settle comfortably at The Ivy Lake and prepare to discover the archaeological treasures that await you.

activities.text: First discovery of Anuradhapura in the late afternoon, an ideal opportunity to soak up the spiritual atmosphere of this millennia-old sacred city.

visits.text: Explore the sacred city of Anuradhapura, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and Sri Lanka's first capital for over 1,400 years. This exceptional archaeological site houses monumental dagobas, ancient monasteries, and sacred pools that bear witness to the grandeur of ancient Sinhalese civilization.

Contemplate the Sri Maha Bodhi, the oldest documented sacred tree in the world, planted over 2,300 years ago from a cutting of the tree under which Buddha attained enlightenment. Pilgrims from around the world come to meditate beneath its venerable branches in an atmosphere of profound devotion.

Admire the Ruwanwelisaya, one of the largest stupas in the ancient world standing 103 meters tall. This architectural marvel, built in the 2nd century BC, impresses with its immaculate whiteness and the hundreds of elephant statues adorning its base.

activities.text: Visit the Abhayagiri Vihara, an ancient monastic complex that was one of the largest Buddhist learning centers in the world, hosting up to 5,000 monks from across Asia.
Discover the Jetavanaramaya, once the third tallest building in the ancient world after the pyramids of Giza, an impressive testament to Sri Lankan architectural prowess.

visits.text: En route to Sigiriya, stop at the Golden Temple of Dambulla, a complex of five caves carved into rock and adorned with over 150 Buddha statues and extraordinary wall frescoes dating back to the 1st century BC. This UNESCO site transports you into a world of spirituality and Buddhist art of striking beauty.

Ascend the Lion Rock of Sigiriya, one of the wonders of the ancient world. This spectacular fortress, perched 200 meters high, was built in the 5th century by King Kashyapa. Climb the 1,200 steps while admiring the famous frescoes of the Sigiriya Maidens and the perfectly preserved water gardens.

activities.text: Stroll through the royal gardens at the foot of Sigiriya, considered among the oldest landscaped gardens in Asia, with their fountains, pools, and geometric terraces showcasing remarkable hydraulic engineering.

visits.text: Climb Pidurangala Rock at sunrise for a breathtaking panoramic view of Sigiriya bathed in the golden glow of dawn. This spiritual hike leads you through an ancient Buddhist temple and rewards your efforts with one of Sri Lanka's most beautiful panoramas.

Explore the ancient royal city of Polonnaruwa, Sri Lanka's second medieval capital, where impressive ruins bear witness to the splendor of the Sinhalese kingdom in the 11th and 12th centuries. The Gal Vihara, with its four monumental Buddhas carved from granite, represents a masterpiece of world Buddhist art.

activities.text: Embark on an afternoon safari at Minneriya National Park to witness the famous 'Gathering,' the largest gathering of Asian elephants. From June to September, up to 300 pachyderms congregate around the ancient reservoir, offering an unforgettable natural spectacle.

visits.text: Scenic drive to Kandy through the country's verdant mountains. Arrival in the former royal capital, the last residence of Sinhalese kings before British colonization. This picturesque city, nestled in the hills and bordered by an artificial lake, exudes a unique atmosphere blending spirituality and colonial charm.

Visit the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic (Sri Dalada Maligawa), Sri Lanka's most revered sanctuary housing the relic of Buddha's tooth. This majestic temple, at the heart of a palatial complex, forms the spiritual center of the island and attracts millions of pilgrims each year.

activities.text: Attend a traditional Kandyan dance performance, a centuries-old art form inscribed on the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage list. Dancers in sumptuous costumes perform mesmerizing choreographies to the rhythm of drums, culminating with the impressive fire-walking ceremony.

visits.text: Explore the Royal Botanic Gardens of Peradeniya, the finest in Asia with 60 hectares of tropical splendor. Admire the avenue of royal palms, the orchid collection, centuries-old trees, and colonies of giant fruit bats hanging from the monumental ficus trees.

Stroll around Kandy Lake, created by the last King of Kandy in the early 19th century. This peaceful body of water, bordered by temples and colonial mansions, offers a romantic escape in the heart of the historic city.

activities.text: Participate in an authentic Sri Lankan cooking class and learn to prepare a traditional curry with local spices. A culinary and cultural experience that will allow you to bring the island's flavors home to your own kitchen.

visits.text: Spectacular drive to the highlands through tea plantations that carpet the hills in brilliant emerald green. Stop to photograph Tamil tea pickers in colorful saris harvesting the precious leaves using ancestral techniques unchanged since colonial times.

Discover Haputale, a charming village perched at 1,400 meters altitude offering dizzying views over the southern plains. On clear days, you can glimpse the island's southern coast from this natural viewpoint nestled in the heart of the tea plantations.

activities.text: Visit a tea factory to understand the process of transforming fresh leaves into the world-renowned Ceylon tea. Taste different varieties and take home a few packets of this mountain nectar.
Admire the waterfalls that dot the region, true natural jewels cascading from the verdant mountains in a setting of lush tropical forest.

visits.text: Arrival in Ella, a little paradise nestled in the mountains of tea country. This bohemian village charms with its laid-back atmosphere, breathtaking landscapes, and numerous hiking opportunities through tea plantations and cloud forests.

Hike to Little Adam's Peak for a panoramic view of the Ella Valley and surrounding mountains. This accessible 45-minute walk passes through tea plantations and rewards hikers with a magnificent panorama over Ella Gap.

activities.text: Visit Ravana Falls, a mythical 25-meter waterfall linked to the legend of the Ramayana. According to the Hindu epic, the demon king Ravana hid Princess Sita in a cave behind these tumbling waters.
Discover a local tea factory and learn the secrets of making the famous Ceylon tea, from picking to drying and fermentation.

visits.text: Full day exploring Ella and its natural treasures. Hike to the summit of Ella Rock for a spectacular view of the verdant mountains and misty valleys. The trail passes through tea plantations, Tamil villages, and dense forests before reaching this exceptional viewpoint.

Discover the famous Nine Arch Bridge, a masterpiece of colonial architecture built entirely of bricks and stones without any metal framework. This photogenic railway viaduct, lost amid the tea plantations, is one of Sri Lanka's most iconic landmarks.

activities.text: Swim in the natural pools of Diyaluma Falls or Ravana Falls, a welcome refreshment after hiking through the verdant hills of tea country.
Wander through Ella's cafés and restaurants, savoring local cuisine and the relaxed atmosphere of this village that has become a haven for travelers from around the world.

visits.text: Drive to the south coast with a safari at Yala National Park, Sri Lanka's most famous and one of the best places in the world to spot leopards. This 979 km² sanctuary boasts the highest density of leopards in the world, along with elephants, crocodiles, sloth bears, and exceptional birdlife.

activities.text: 4x4 safari in Yala Park in search of the Sri Lankan leopard, a subspecies endemic to the island. Experienced guides take you through savannas, lagoons, and dry forests where these majestic felines and many other wild species hide.
Arrival in Tangalle in the late afternoon, settling into your oceanfront accommodation to enjoy a memorable sunset over the golden beaches of the south coast.

visits.text: Day of relaxation on the pristine beaches of Tangalle, one of the most beautiful seaside resorts in southern Sri Lanka. These long stretches of golden sand lined with coconut palms offer an idyllic setting for swimming and lounging far from tourist crowds.

activities.text: Tuk-tuk excursion discovering the region's secret beaches: Hiriketiya Bay for surfing, Silent Beach for absolute tranquility, and Rekawa Beach famous for nighttime observation of sea turtles coming to lay eggs on the sand.
Savor fresh seafood at beach restaurants, a specialty of this fishing coast where grilled fish and crab curries are prepared according to recipes passed down through generations.

visits.text: Coastal drive to Galle, Sri Lanka's colonial pearl. Explore Galle Fort, a fortified citadel built by the Portuguese in the 16th century and later expanded by the Dutch. This exceptionally preserved UNESCO site blends European architecture with tropical charm in a labyrinth of cobbled streets lined with antique shops and trendy cafés.

Stroll along the fort's ramparts at sunset, a magical moment when locals come out for evening walks and the historic lighthouse illuminates facing the Indian Ocean. The views over the bay and red-tiled rooftops are simply spectacular.

activities.text: Visit the Dutch Reformed Church, the Maritime Museum, and the old colonial mansions transformed into elegant boutique hotels. Galle's unique atmosphere evokes a journey back in time to the era of trading posts.

Enjoy a cinnamon tea at one of the fort's picturesque cafés, savoring the bohemian-chic atmosphere of this city of art and history that has become a gathering place for creators and authenticity seekers.

visits.text: Day of relaxation on the paradise beaches around Galle. Unawatuna, with its crescent of golden sand protected by a coral reef, offers calm waters ideal for swimming and snorkeling among colorful tropical fish.

activities.text: Explore nearby beaches including Jungle Beach, a secret cove accessible only on foot, or Mirissa for dolphin and blue whale watching on a boat excursion (in season from December to April).
Try surfing the waves at Unawatuna or Weligama, spots renowned for beginners and experienced surfers alike, with numerous schools offering lessons and board rentals.

visits.text: Drive to Negombo, a vibrant seaside resort close to the international airport. This Catholic fishing town offers a unique atmosphere in Sri Lanka with its baroque churches, bustling fish market, and long beaches lined with coconut palms.

Explore the Dutch Fort quarter and Hamilton Canal, vestiges of the Dutch colonial era. Negombo's fish market, one of the largest in the country, offers a fascinating spectacle in the early morning when fishermen unload their night's catch.

activities.text: Cruise on Negombo Lagoon aboard a traditional catamaran to observe waterbirds, mangroves, and the daily life of fishing communities. A peaceful escape from the bustle of the city.
Final Sri Lankan evening on Negombo Beach, savoring grilled seafood and tropical cocktails facing the sunset over the Indian Ocean.

visits.text: Transfer to Bandaranaike International Airport for your return flight. Take with you the unforgettable memories of this journey through Sri Lanka, its ancient temples, tea plantations, paradise beaches, and the warmth of its welcoming people.

activities.text: Last-minute souvenir shopping: Ceylon tea, spices, handcrafted batiks, and precious stone jewelry, specialties of the island of a thousand treasures.

seo.h1_title: The Complete Sri Lanka Road Trip: Ancient Temples, Tea Hills & Tropical Beaches
seo.intro_paragraph: Discover the jewel of the Indian Ocean on this epic 16-day journey through Sri Lanka's cultural heart and pristine coastline. From the sacred ruins of Anuradhapura to the legendary Lion Rock of Sigiriya, through misty tea plantations and leopard-roaming national parks, this itinerary unveils the island's extraordinary diversity of ancient wonders, natural beauty, and warm hospitality.
seo.seo_hook: Where ancient kingdoms meet emerald tea hills and golden beaches kiss the Indian Ocean.
featured_list: The sacred ruins of Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa, UNESCO World Heritage Sites
Sigiriya Lion Rock, the eighth wonder of the ancient world
Leopard safari at Yala National Park
Scenic tea plantations and the charming hill town of Ella
Colonial Galle Fort and the paradise beaches of the south coast
The Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy

places_taglines.LK::colombo: Vibrant capital where colonial heritage meets modern Sri Lankan life
places_taglines.LK::anuradhapura: Sacred city of ancient stupas and the world's oldest documented tree
places_taglines.LK::sigiriya: The legendary Lion Rock fortress rising from the jungle canopy
places_taglines.LK::kandy: Royal highland capital guarding Buddha's sacred tooth relic
places_taglines.LK::haputale: Misty mountain village with panoramic views over endless tea estates
places_taglines.LK::ella: Bohemian hill station paradise for trekkers and train lovers
places_taglines.LK::tangalle: Unspoiled golden beaches where sea turtles nest under starlit skies
places_taglines.LK::galle: Colonial fort jewel blending Dutch heritage with tropical charm
places_taglines.LK::negombo: Fishing town gateway where your Sri Lankan adventure begins and ends

itineraries.title: CULTURAL TRIANGLE — TEMPLES AND ANCIENT CITIES 7 DAYS
itineraries.notes: Immersion dans l'histoire millénaire du Sri Lanka à travers les sites UNESCO du triangle culturel. Temples rupestres, forteresses royales et statues monumentales.

visits.text: Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi Tree, cutting from Buddha's enlightenment tree, oldest historically documented tree in the world.
Ruwanwelisaya, monumental white stupa from the 2nd century BC.
Thuparamaya, first dagoba built in Sri Lanka after the introduction of Buddhism.

activities.text: Bicycle tour through the sacred ruins of Anuradhapura.
Observing pilgrims during evening puja at the temple.

visits.text: Abhayagiri Monastery, monastic complex with 75m high dagoba.
Isurumuniya Rock Temple, rock temple with ancient erotic sculptures.
Kuttam Pokuna twin pools, masterpieces of ancient hydraulic engineering.

activities.text: Meditation in the peaceful gardens of ancient monasteries.
Visit to a Buddhist statuette making workshop.

visits.text: Lion Rock of Sigiriya, 5th century fortified citadel with frescoes of the maidens.
Archaeological Museum of Sigiriya presenting the history of the site and its discoveries.

activities.text: Morning ascent of the rock to avoid the heat and enjoy the view.
Traditional Ayurvedic massage at the end of the day.

visits.text: Golden Temple of Dambulla, 5 sacred caves adorned with 150 Buddha statues and wall frescoes.
Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium, unique stadium built in 167 days.

activities.text: Sunrise hike to the temple for magical lighting.
Visit to a local organic fruit and vegetable farm.
Traditional Sri Lankan cooking workshop with a local family.

visits.text: Royal Palace of Parakramabahu, remains of the grandeur of the ancient medieval capital.
Gal Vihara, four monumental statues of Buddha carved in granite.
Circular Vatadage, unique sanctuary that once housed a tooth relic.

activities.text: Electric bike circuit through the archaeological park.
Swimming in Parakrama Samudra reservoir at sunset.

visits.text: Pidurangala Rock, neighboring rock to Sigiriya offering spectacular views of Lion Rock.
Traditional Hiriwadunna village, immersion in Sri Lankan rural life.

activities.text: Safari at Minneriya National Park to observe wild elephants by the lake.

visits.text: Temple of the Sacred Tooth, major Buddhist sanctuary housing a relic of Buddha.
Royal Botanical Gardens of Peradeniya, 147 acres of lush vegetation.
Kandy Cultural Centre with traditional Kandyan dance performance.

activities.text: Stroll around Kandy lake at the end of the day.

seo.h1_title: Sri Lanka's Cultural Triangle Guide: Ancient Cities & Sacred Temples
seo.intro_paragraph: Explore Anuradhapura and its dagobas amid jungle, then climb toward Sigiriya and its history-laden stones. Discover Polonnaruwa and its sculpted guardians, then explore Dambulla's temples before reaching Kandy and its venerated relic. Here, each site connects spirituality, art and memory, in a landscape inviting silence.
seo.seo_hook: Dagobas rising from canopy, stone Buddhas guarding forgotten cities, cave temples glowing gold at dusk. Sacred Ceylon.

places_taglines.LK::anuradhapura: sacred city bodhi tree ancient dagobas
places_taglines.LK::sigiriya: rock fortress frescoes lion paw gateway
places_taglines.LK::dambulla: cave temples golden buddha candlelit devotion
places_taglines.LK::polonnaruwa: medieval capital stone buddhas gal vihara
places_taglines.LK::kandy: temple tooth relic hill station culture

itineraries.title: PEARL OF THE INDIAN OCEAN
itineraries.notes: Du Triangle Culturel aux plages du sud, en passant par les plantations de thé. Un voyage qui combine histoire millénaire, nature luxuriante et détente balnéaire.

visits.text: Gangaramaya Temple, eclectic Buddhist sanctuary blending Sri Lankan, Thai and Indian architecture.
Pettah Market, colorful bazaar where spices, textiles and local crafts intermingle.
Galle Face Green, seaside promenade popular at sunset.

activities.text: Taste fresh kottu roti prepared in front of you at a street restaurant.
Walk through the colonial Fort district with its Dutch and British period buildings.

visits.text: Golden Temple of Dambulla, rock complex with 5 caves decorated with Buddhist frescoes.
Lion Rock of Sigiriya, 5th-century royal fortress perched at 200m altitude.

activities.text: Morning climb to the summit of Sigiriya to admire the maiden frescoes and panoramic view.
Meeting with local artisans specialized in wood carving.

visits.text: Medieval city of Polonnaruwa, former royal capital classified as UNESCO with temples and monumental statues.
Gal Vihara, ensemble of Buddha statues carved in granite, masterpiece of Sinhalese art.

activities.text: Bicycle tour through archaeological ruins among monkeys and wild peacocks.
Visit to a traditional village to discover ancestral agricultural techniques.

visits.text: Temple of the Sacred Tooth, sanctuary housing a relic of Buddha, holy site of Buddhism.
Peradeniya Botanical Garden, 60 hectares of tropical vegetation with rare orchids and majestic palm trees.

activities.text: Attend the daily Puja ceremony at the Temple of the Tooth, impressive ritual with drums and music.
Walk around Kandy lake at sunset.

visits.text: Tea plantations of Nuwara Eliya, rolling landscapes of tea plants as far as the eye can see.
Pedro Tea Factory, guided tour of Ceylon tea manufacturing process with tasting.
Colonial downtown of Nuwara Eliya nicknamed Little England for its British architecture.

activities.text: Walk through the plantations to observe tea pickers at work.

visits.text: Nine Arches Bridge, iconic railway bridge nestled in the jungle.
Little Adam's Peak, easy hike offering spectacular views of green hills.

activities.text: Scenic train journey from Nanu Oya to Ella, one of the most beautiful railway routes in the world.

visits.text: Yala National Park, reserve famous for its high density of leopards.

activities.text: 4x4 safari at dawn to observe leopards, elephants, bears and crocodiles.

visits.text: Mulkirigala Temple, rock monastery perched on a 200m rock with panoramic view.
Tangalle Beach, long stretch of golden sand bordered by palm trees.

activities.text: Swimming and relaxation on the quiet beaches of the south coast.

visits.text: Mirissa fishing port, authentic coastal village with colorful boats.
Mirissa Beach, crescent-shaped bay ideal for surfing and relaxation.

activities.text: Sea excursion to observe blue whales and spinner dolphins in season.

visits.text: Galle Fort, Dutch colonial fortress UNESCO-listed with ramparts facing the ocean.
Galle Lighthouse, iconic fort building offering stunning views of the Indian Ocean.
National Maritime Museum tracing the colonial and maritime history of the region.

activities.text: Strolling through the fort's cobbled streets in search of art galleries and craft shops.

visits.text: Bentota Beach, renowned seaside resort with fine sand and turquoise water.
Bentota River, peaceful estuary bordered by mangroves.

activities.text: Water sports on the beach: jet-ski, windsurfing or kayak.
Sunset cruise on the Bentota river to observe birds and crocodiles.

visits.text: Kosgoda sea turtle sanctuary, turtle protection and rehabilitation center.
Hikkaduwa beach, snorkeling spot with coral reef near the shore.

activities.text: Snorkeling to swim among tropical fish and sea turtles.
Surfing session on the accessible waves of Hikkaduwa.

visits.text: Negombo fish market, lively morning spectacle with fishermen's arrival.
Dutch canal of Negombo, colonial remnant running along the city.
Saint Mary's Church of Negombo, imposing pink cathedral testifying to Catholic influence.

activities.text: Bike ride along the canals to discover local life.
Tasting of freshly caught seafood in a seaside restaurant.

visits.text: National Museum of Colombo, collection of Sri Lankan historical and artistic objects.
Cinnamon Gardens district, green residential area with colonial buildings.

activities.text: Shopping at Odel shopping center or in local craft shops.
Dinner in a gourmet restaurant offering modern Sri Lankan fusion cuisine.

visits.text: Beira Lake, urban lake in the heart of Colombo with floating temple Seema Malaka.
Viharamahadevi Park, largest park in Colombo ideal for a final stroll.

activities.text: Last purchases of souvenirs and spices at the local market.
Relaxation in an Ayurvedic spa for a traditional Sri Lankan massage.

seo.h1_title: Sri Lanka Complete Itinerary: Ancient Temples, Tea Country and Beaches
seo.intro_paragraph: Explore Sigiriya and its iconic rock, then reach Kandy and its temples in the heart of the hills. Take the train to Ella through the tea plantations, before heading south to the beaches around Galle. Sri Lanka alternates sacred sites, mountain landscapes and marine light, with a gentle intensity that accompanies every step.
seo.seo_hook: Lion Rock rising from mist, tea terraces cascading down emerald slopes, whales breaching from turquoise waters. Sri Lanka, worlds within a world.

itineraries.title: SECRET PATHS — OFF THE BEATEN TRACK 12 DAYS
itineraries.notes: Découverte du Sri Lanka authentique loin des foules touristiques. Villages isolés, temples méconnus, plages désertes et rencontres locales.

visits.text: Puttalam Lagoon, preserved wetland sheltering pink flamingos and migratory birds.
Muslim fishing village of Kalpitiya with its colorful mosques.

activities.text: Traditional boat ride through salt marshes at sunrise.
Meeting with fishing communities and tasting local dried fish.

visits.text: Wilpattu National Park, little-frequented wildlife reserve famous for its villus (natural lakes).

activities.text: 4x4 safari in Sri Lanka's oldest park to observe leopards and sloth bears.

visits.text: Forest monastery of Ritigala, mysterious ruins buried in thick jungle.
Sacred summit of Ritigala, isolated mountain surrounded by Buddhist legends.

activities.text: Guided hike through dense forest to discover ancient pools and monks' cells.

visits.text: Vatadage of Medirigiriya, 7th-century circular sanctuary isolated and rarely visited.
Surrounding rural village with welcoming inhabitants and traditional way of life.

activities.text: Immersion in a farming family to discover ancestral cultivation techniques.
Participation in preparing a traditional village meal.

visits.text: Dutch bridge of Batticaloa renowned for its mysterious sounds emitted at night.
Batticaloa lagoon, vast expanse of water with islets and isolated Hindu temples.
Dutch fort of Batticaloa, colonial remnant on the edge of the lagoon.

activities.text: Nighttime walk on the bridge to listen to the enigmatic sounds of singing fish.
Tasting Tamil specialties in a local family restaurant.

visits.text: Arugam Bay beach, world-renowned surf spot but still preserved.
Arugam fishing village with its colorful huts and traditional boats.

activities.text: Surfing session on the legendary waves of Main Point.
Bike ride to surrounding lagoons to observe wild elephants.

visits.text: Panama Beach, wild stretch of golden sand practically deserted.
Panama Lagoon, sanctuary of water birds and crocodiles.

activities.text: Coastal hike to isolated coves accessible only on foot.
Sunset watching on the deserted beach in complete solitude.

visits.text: Kataragama Temple, sacred site for Buddhists, Hindus and Muslims together.
Menik Ganga River where pilgrims bathe ritually.

activities.text: Participation in the nocturnal Puja ceremony with procession and fires.
Meeting with pilgrims from all over the country to share their stories.

visits.text: Lake Tissa, peaceful body of water with Buddhist temples on its shores.
Yatala Vehera Dagoba, ancient stupa in a quiet rural village.

activities.text: Sunset walk around the lake with waterbird watching.
Dinner at a local home in a village family farm.

visits.text: Dondra Lighthouse, southernmost point of Sri Lanka with panoramic view.
Dondra Maha Vihara Temple, ancient Buddhist site off the tourist trail.

activities.text: Exploration of the deserted beaches of the southern tip.
Swimming in isolated coves accessible by coastal paths.

visits.text: Rekawa Beach, sea turtle nesting site rarely visited.
Rekawa Lagoon, preserved wetland rich in biodiversity.

activities.text: Nighttime observation of sea turtles coming to lay their eggs on the beach.
Kayaking in the lagoon at sunrise to observe birds and crocodiles.

visits.text: Village of Ahangama, authentic coastal community with preserved traditions.
Traditional Sri Lankan mask-making workshop.

activities.text: Introduction to stick fishing with local fishermen on their iconic poles.
Sunset yoga class in a beachfront studio.

seo.h1_title: Secret Sri Lanka: Hidden Trails Beyond the Tourist Paths
seo.intro_paragraph: Explore Wilpattu and its wild landscapes, then discover Ritigala and its ruins hidden in forest. Reach Arugam Bay to feel the coastal energy, then follow Batticaloa lagoon before reaching Kataragama, pilgrimage high place. This more secret Sri Lanka blends nature, spirituality and roads that stray from the obvious.
seo.seo_hook: Leopards melting into wilderness, forest-swallowed ruins guarding mysteries, pilgrims walking on embers. Secret Sri Lanka.

itineraries.title: SPICY FLAVORS — 10-DAY GASTRONOMIC ODYSSEY
itineraries.notes: Voyage culinaire à travers l'île aux épices. Marchés colorés, ateliers de cuisine, plantations de thé et dégustation de spécialités régionales.

visits.text: Pettah Market, maze of alleys with spice merchants, tropical fruits and exotic vegetables.
Old Dutch Hospital, colonial complex converted into restaurants and gourmet shops.

activities.text: Sri Lankan cooking workshop with local chef to learn authentic rice & curry.

visits.text: Negombo fish market, morning spectacle with boat arrivals and lively auctions.
Lellama Fish Market, secondary market where you can buy ultra-fresh fish and seafood.

activities.text: Seafood curry preparation class with a fishing family.
Tasting of lagoon crabs cooked over wood fire.

visits.text: Coconut plantation with demonstration of oil and toddy production.
Chilaw local market renowned for its lagoon crabs.

activities.text: Cooking workshop for coconut-based specialties: sambol, pol roti and kiri bath.
Tasting of fermented toddy and local arrack at a producer's.

visits.text: Matale spice garden, plantation with cinnamon, cardamom, pepper, vanilla and nutmeg.
Heritage Spice Garden with demonstration of spice harvesting and processing.

activities.text: Course on preparing spice blends for curries and sambols.
Tasting of traditional spicy dishes in a village restaurant.

visits.text: Kandy municipal market, stalls overflowing with tropical fruits, vegetables and aromatic herbs.
Empire Café, local institution to taste Sri Lankan colonial pastries.

activities.text: Visit to a jaggery candy factory with tasting.
Dinner show with Kandyan dances and buffet of local specialties.

visits.text: Pedro tea factory with complete visit of the manufacturing process and guided tasting.
Tea Bush Café in the middle of plantations to savor pastries and premium teas.

activities.text: Guided walk through plantations with picking demonstration by Tamil women.
Tea tasting workshop to learn to differentiate grades and aromas.

visits.text: Café Chill with panoramic mountain views, specializing in creative vegetarian dishes.
Mini Adam's Peak with stop at mountain restaurants serving homemade rice and curry.

activities.text: Scenic train journey through tea plantations with local snack tasting on board.

visits.text: Galle market with seafood, mango, papaya and jackfruit stalls.
Pédé Street Food to taste the best kottu roti on the south coast.

activities.text: Cooking class in Galle fort to master hoppers and sambols.
Artisanal arrack distillery visit with tasting.

visits.text: Weligama fish market where fishermen sell their daily catch.
Beach restaurants serving freshly caught grilled fish.

activities.text: Workshop on preparing ambulthiyal fish curries Weligama style.
Tasting of curd (buffalo yogurt) with palm honey at a local farm.
Seafood barbecue dinner with feet in the sand at sunset.

visits.text: Ministry of Crab, gourmet restaurant famous for its lagoon crabs prepared in multiple ways.
Good Market, weekly organic market with farm products and creative street food.

activities.text: Shopping for quality spices and teas to take home at the Tea Board Shop.
Closing dinner at a fusion restaurant blending Sri Lankan traditions and modern techniques.

seo.h1_title: Sri Lanka Spice Trail: Culinary Journey Through Ceylon's Flavors
seo.intro_paragraph: Explore Pettah in Colombo and its spice markets, then reach Matale and its fragrant gardens. In Kandy, let local kitchens and rice curry gestures guide you, before reaching Galle and its maritime influences. End at Weligama around seafood stalls. In Sri Lanka, flavors tell the country as much as its temples.
seo.seo_hook: Cinnamon bark curling in gardens, curry leaves sizzling in clay pots, seafood feasts on southern shores. Ceylon's spices set the senses ablaze.

places_taglines.LK::colombo: pettah spice markets street food adventure
places_taglines.LK::negombo: lagoon seafood fish market morning catch
places_taglines.LK::chilaw: fishing port fresh crab curry traditions
places_taglines.LK::matale: spice gardens cinnamon cardamom pepper estates
places_taglines.LK::kandy: cooking classes market tours hill cuisine
places_taglines.LK::nuwara-eliya: tea factory tours highland vegetable gardens
places_taglines.LK::ella: hoppers kottu rotti mountain cafe culture
places_taglines.LK::galle: fort restaurants fusion seafood colonial ambiance
places_taglines.LK::weligama: beachside grills fresh catch sunset dining

visits.text: Explore Negombo Beach and its fishing boats with colorful sails.
Visit the Lellama Fish Market, the second largest in Sri Lanka.
Discover colonial-era churches like St. Mary’s Church in Negombo, known as 'Little Rome'.
Take a boat tour across Negombo Lagoon and its mangrove ecosystems.

activities.text: Relax on the sandy beaches of Negombo.
Observe birdlife and local fishermen on Negombo Lagoon.

visits.text: Visit the historical Colombo Fort area before boarding the train to Kandy.
Admire colonial landmarks such as the Lighthouse Clock Tower and Old Parliament Building.

activities.text: Take the scenic train from Colombo Fort to Kandy through rice paddies and hills.
Stroll along Kandy Lake and enjoy the mountain backdrop.

visits.text: Visit the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic, one of Sri Lanka’s holiest Buddhist sites.
Explore the Royal Botanical Gardens in Peradeniya, home to over 4,000 plant species.
Walk around Kandy Market to experience local life and spices.

activities.text: Evening cultural dance show in Kandy featuring Kandyan drummers and dancers.

visits.text: Take the famous train from Kandy to Ella through lush tea plantations and mountain tunnels.
Admire scenic views of Nuwara Eliya and the rolling highlands during the ride.

activities.text: Evening walk through Ella town to explore its cafés and shops.

visits.text: Hike to Little Adam’s Peak for panoramic mountain views.
Visit the iconic Nine Arch Bridge surrounded by tea fields.
Explore Ravana Falls, one of Sri Lanka’s most famous waterfalls.

activities.text: Enjoy a relaxing evening overlooking Ella Rock from your homestay.

visits.text: Morning jeep safari in Udawalawe National Park to observe wild elephants and birdlife.
Visit the Elephant Transit Home to watch orphaned elephants being fed.

activities.text: Optional afternoon safari or relaxation at your lodge.

visits.text: Drive through the southern countryside to reach Hiriketiya Bay.
Relax at Hiriketiya Beach, a horseshoe-shaped bay known for its surf and scenery.

activities.text: Swim or surf in Hiriketiya Bay.
Evening stroll to Dikwella Beach and explore local eateries.

visits.text: Travel along the southern coast from Hiriketiya to Mirissa.
Relax on Mirissa Beach and visit Coconut Tree Hill for sunset views.
Discover Secret Beach, a quiet hidden spot near Mirissa.

activities.text: Optional whale watching cruise (November–April).

visits.text: Drive north to Bentota, a coastal paradise with golden beaches and rivers.
Take a boat safari on the Bentota River through mangrove forests.
Relax on Bentota Beach, one of the most beautiful in Sri Lanka.

activities.text: Snorkeling or river cruise in Bentota lagoon.

visits.text: Return drive from Bentota to Negombo, near Bandaranaike International Airport.
Relax before departure or take a final stroll along Negombo Beach.

activities.text: Optional shopping or spa treatment before your flight.

seo.h1_title: Southwest Sri Lanka: Hill Country, Wildlife and Golden Beaches
seo.intro_paragraph: Depart from Negombo and its fishing village atmosphere, then reach Kandy between sacred hills and local fervor. Board the train to Ella through tea plantations, then follow Udawalawe to the rhythm of elephants, before reaching Hiriketiya for surf spirit and Mirissa to watch whales offshore.
seo.seo_hook: Sacred temples crowning misty hills, trains winding through emerald tea bushes, elephants gathering at golden hour. Southwest Sri Lanka, island dream.

places_taglines.LK::negombo: fishing boats lagoon church spires gateway
places_taglines.LK::kandy: perahera drums botanical gardens temple lake
places_taglines.LK::ella: iconic train journey little adams peak
places_taglines.LK::udawalawe: elephant orphanage national park grassland herds
places_taglines.LK::hiriketiya: horseshoe bay surf beach bohemian hideaway
places_taglines.LK::mirissa: whale season palm beach sunrise bliss
places_taglines.LK::bentota: golden sand ayurveda spa river cruises

itineraries.title: WILD COASTS & SAFARIS — NATURE AND BEACHES 10 DAYS
itineraries.notes: De la jungle luxuriante aux plages paradisiaques du sud. Safaris, observation des baleines, surf et détente balnéaire.

visits.text: Udawalawe National Park, sanctuary for wild elephants with more than 500 individuals.

activities.text: Jeep safari to observe elephants, water buffalo and aquatic birds.

visits.text: Yala National Park, reserve with the highest density of leopards in the world.

activities.text: Morning safari in search of elusive leopards.
Evening safari to observe sloth bears and marsh crocodiles.

visits.text: Hummanaya Blow Hole, natural marine geyser propelling water 25m high.
Secret beaches of Tangalle, deserted coves bordered by palm trees.

activities.text: Snorkeling in little-frequented coral reefs.
Swimming and relaxation on Silent Beach or Goyambokka Beach.

visits.text: Weligama Beach, peaceful bay renowned for its surf schools.
Stilt fishermen, traditional fishing technique emblematic of Sri Lanka.

activities.text: Beginner surf lessons on the gentle waves of Weligama Bay.
Visit to a sea turtle farm to see baby turtles.

visits.text: Coconut Tree Hill, iconic hill with alignment of coconut trees facing the ocean.
Parrot Rock, rock accessible at low tide with panoramic view of Mirissa Beach.

activities.text: Boat excursion to observe blue whales and sperm whales in season.
Sunset with cocktail on the lively beach of Mirissa.

visits.text: Galle Fort, colonial fortified city with ramparts, churches and Dutch buildings.
Dutch Reformed Church, 18th century church with tombstone floor.
National maritime museum retracing the colonial epic and spice trade.

activities.text: Walk on the ramparts at sunset with ocean view.

visits.text: Unawatuna Beach, horseshoe bay with golden sand and calm water.
Jungle Beach, small secret cove accessible by jungle trail.

activities.text: Snorkeling on the coral reef of Unawatuna.
Stand-up paddle in the tranquil bay at sunrise.

visits.text: Brief Garden, tropical garden created by architect Bevis Bawa with sculptures and lush vegetation.
Bentota Beach, long stretch of sand bordered by palm trees.

activities.text: Water sports: jet-ski, banana boat or wakeboard on the river.
Sunset cruise on the Bentota River with bird watching.

visits.text: Hikkaduwa coral reef, marine sanctuary accessible from the beach.
Tsunami Honganji Vihara, Buddhist temple built after the 2004 tsunami.

activities.text: Scuba diving initiation in crystal-clear waters.
Surfing on waves suitable for all levels.

visits.text: Galle Face Green, seaside promenade where Colombo residents gather.
Pettah district, chaotic and colorful market with its themed alleyways.

activities.text: Local street food tasting: kottu, hoppers and wade.
Traditional Ayurvedic massage to beautifully conclude the trip.

seo.h1_title: Sri Lanka's Wild South: Yala Safari, Tangalle Beaches & Jungle Temples
seo.intro_paragraph: Follow dawn in Yala's plains searching for leopards, then reach Udawalawe and its elephants. Head out to Mirissa to watch whales, then relax on Tangalle beaches where jungle meets sea. Southern Sri Lanka blends wildlife, coastal villages and wide tropical horizons.
seo.seo_hook: Leopards prowling through golden grasslands, blue whales rising from depths, jungle tumbling toward deserted beaches. Wild Sri Lanka.
